title: Wilson Creek 2016 Cammi Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried blackberries, pepper-crusted meats and dried lilac aromas make for a lively nose on this bottling. The palate combines roasted meat with plump berry flavors, proving quite juicy, and even veering into candied red-apple and melon flavors.

title: Xavier Flouret 2017 French Blonde  (Sancerre)
description: Produced by the Millet family, this ripe wine with touches of minerality is about rich fruits and balanced acidity. Hints of apricots and pineapple balance the citrus thread that goes through the wine. Drink now.

title: Zonte's Footstep 2015 Avalon Tree Cabernet Sauvignon (Fleurieu Peninsula)
description: This is a full-bodied wine that is rich and likable. Black cherry, vanilla and green bell pepper notes are held up by a dusty, earthy spine and drying, tight tannins. This could use some time for those tannins to soften. Drink now–2028.

title: Ca'Romè 2013 Chiaramanti Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Cedar, espresso and grilled herb aromas lead the nose. The assertive palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and toasted oak alongside raspy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Colosi 2014 Passito Moscato (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with dried Moscato grapes, this opens with aromas of beeswax, candied apricot and marzipan. The sweet, straightforward palate offers chestnut honey and almond.

title: Acumen 2014 Mountainside Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 7% Merlot plus smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this well-made wine is understated in its rich rounded smoothness, decadent in black cherry and a caramelized taste of vanilla.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Terras de Cartaxo Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: Cartaxo is a village on the west bank of the Tagus river that's home to eastern-facing wine vineyards. This wine, bold and fruity, shows the warmth of the vineyards, bringing out fine black fruits, rich tannins and final juicy acidity. It is young and packed with fruit at this stage and will certainly be better from 2019.

title: Aljibes 2014 Selectus Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, prune, vanilla and cola are a high point on this muscular blend from Albacete in warm central Spain. A soupy palate could be dismissed as too heavy and woody. Flavors of clove, chocolate and thick berries are minty, chocolaty and a bit hot on the finish. Lovers of massive reds will be happier than fans of leaner, more traditional Old World wines.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, clear and freshly focused wine, direct in its lemon freshness and strong flavors of grapefruit, green apple and tenacious acidity.

title: Baron Albert NV L'Universelle Brut  (Champagne)
description: This open, fruity wine offers good acidity and a soft texture. The 70% Pinot Meunier in the blend, grown in the Marne Valley, gives a rounded, warm character to the wine. Drink now.

title: Batasiolo 2014 Brunate  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting porcini mushroom, tilled soil, new leather and star anise that carry over to the austere palate along with clove, dried cherry and powdered sage. Tight close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity provide support. Drink 2019–2024.

title: Battaglio 2015  Barbaresco
description: This opens with underbrush, mocha and dark-fruit aromas. The assertive palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside bracing tannins that lead to a clenching finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Bel Vino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Freshly smashed red fruits meet with hints of pine oil and herbs on the nose of this bottling. It lands somewhat sweetly on the palate with ripe red cherry, and then comes a wave of light, pleasant herbs.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose is initially quite earth-laden, but opens with aeration to reveal delicate aromas of tangerine and lemon zest. A pristine white-grapefruit flavor on the palate is marked by hints of lime and salt. This is a dry, briskly composed wine to enjoy now–2023.

title: Bodegas Caro 2015 Caro Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Compact aromas of prune and desiccated berry fruits lead to a plump but somewhat flat palate that's lacking in verve. Burnt, spicy black fruit flavors include a note of green, while this blend is distinctly herbal and minty on the finish.

title: Bougrier 2017 Domaine Guenault Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This soft, ripe wine has attractive layers of apricot fruitiness as well as crisper citrus acidity. Together these two flavors give the wine delicious freshiness and zesty acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Broadside 2016 Margarita Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dried berries, loamy earth and dried mint show on the nose of this fairly priced Cab that's great for everyday sipping and versatile with a variety of foods. The palate combines dried plum flavors with a strong sense of dried herbs and earthy elements.

title: Bulas 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This sweeter style of Port has generous tannins surrounded by full blackberry fruits. It is rich, certainly, packed with fruit and with a core of dryness that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2027.

title: Buttonwood 2016 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This fresh, twist-top bottling makes for a great weekday table win, starting with aromas of light red fruit, oregano and damp wood. There's a strong herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tangy cranberry fruit and lighter texture.

title: Ca' del Baio 2013 Asili Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with toasted oak, tobacco and dark-skinned fruit aromas. The taut palate offers sour cherry, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.
